emission intensity in respect to the V
ones. This effect results from the large ionic
structure. However, when the concentration of Ga
ions gradually increases, the number of the
crystallographic sites that can be occupied by V
rises up, leading to the enhancement of
emission intensity. Moreover, the Ga-doping induces the reduction of the distance between V
ions facilitating the energy transfer between them, which contributed to the V
intensity increase. It is worth noticing that the emission of trivalent V dominates in the spectrum up
to x = 4, while in the case of YGG V
, the emission band prevails. To quantify these changes the
histogram presenting the contribution of the emission intensities (calculated as an integral emission
intensity in appropriate spectral range) of particular oxidation state of vanadium ions to the overall
emission intensity as a function of Ga
concentration is presented in Figure 2c. The observed
emission intensity with respect to the V
causes tuning of the emission color toward red emission (Figure 2d). However, for YGG:V, orange
emission was found. As has been already proven, the V
ions are located mainly in the surface part
of the nanocrystals [23]. Since the morphology and the size of the nanoparticle is independent on the
